title: What are the bases or technicalities for not granting a patent? - Quora

response.answer_text: The requirements for patenting vary slightly between different countries, but some of the common requirements are that the claims claim something that: is useful / has an industrial applicationis new / novelis non-obvious / makes an inventive stepis supported by a corresponding specificationis definite / clearly writtenNote that patents are granted based on the claims meeting those requirements. Most major countries that grant patents have an office with examiners to examine applications. It is their duty to grant patents unless the examiner explains otherwise based on the technicalities of those requirements.

Common Reasons for not issuing patent no new, not novelpreviously invented, i.e. conflicts with earlier issued patent claimsinvention is in public domain having been previously disclosed or openly published,Invention is already in common knowledge or use i.e. prior art
